other_tests.findings: The majority of the images are degraded by motion artifact. There is a 1 cm left lower lobe pulmonary nodule to be followed up with CT in 3 months. No pleural effusion or airspace consolidation is noted. The liver appears normal without obvious focal lesions. There are a few small subcentimeter gallstones near the gallbladder neck with no biliary dilation. Mild inflammatory changes are surrounding the pancreatic head, with no pancreatic duct dilation or necrosis. The spleen and adrenal glands are normal. Multiple bilateral renal cysts are present, with the largest measuring 8.4 x 6.1 x 8.8 cm and no hydronephrosis. Extensive colonic diverticulosis is noted. No enlarged lymph nodes or aggressive bone lesions are identified.
